So the questions we are going to focus on today include work style, chart data interpretation, work simulation, numerical reasoning and the Amazon leadership principles. Now Amazon has a set of 16 leadership principles. If you want to pass your Amazon assessment test, you need to quickly learn and understand these leadership principles. Tip number two is to make sure you practice as many sample test questions as possible before the real Amazon assessment test. Tip number three for passing your Amazon test. This is important. Make sure you practice your test questions under timed conditions. This is important. Now during the real Amazon test, you will be timed. So make sure you get used to that time pressure by practicing the test questions under strict time guidelines. And tip number four, when answering customer based test questions, make sure you put the needs of the customer first and act quickly. So during the real Amazon assessment test, you will have to answer some questions based on how you would deal with customer inquiries. Make sure you always put the needs of the customer first and act really quickly. Amazon is such a successful and brilliant organization because it obsesses about its customers. So make sure you focus on delivering excellent customer service when answering the customer based test questions. And tip number five for passing your Amazon assessment test is to make sure and I have already mentioned this, you learn and understand those 16 Amazon leadership principles. I strongly believe if you learn and understand these leadership principles, you will pass your Amazon test at the first attempt. So the first of our 16 Amazon leadership principles is customer obsession. So this basically means and I've written this in my own words that Amazon always starts with the customer, they earn their trust and they obsess over their needs. The second of our 16 leadership principles is called ownership. So you should always think long-term act for the entire company and never ever say that's not my job. When you work for Amazon, you will take ownership of difficult challenges and help the entire company. The next of our 16 leadership principles that Amazon is invent and simplify. So this basically means that you expect to innovate in your work, you always look to simplify processes, make things easier and more efficient and also embrace external ideas. So you will always ask other people for their views and opinions and embrace external ideas. The next leadership principle of Amazon is that you are right a lot of the time. So this means that you will exhibit strong judgment, you will seek diverse perspectives other people's opinions and then confirm beliefs. The next one is learn and be curious. This is important. So it means that you will continuously learn and develop, explore new possibilities and improve yourself. So if ever you are given the opportunity to undertake training development courses, you will say yes and you will do your best during the training course to learn and improve your skills. The next of our 16 Amazon leadership principles is to hire and develop the best people. This means raising the performance bar, recognising talent and also developing leaders. So if there is someone in your team when you are working at Amazon who has the potential to be a great leader then you should put them forward and support them. The next leadership principle is to always insist on the highest standards. So this is all about maintaining high quality, again raising the bar and fixing problems permanently. So a lot of companies will just put together a solution to a problem that isn't long term. But when you work at Amazon you have to fix the problem permanently. The next leadership principle is to think big. This means that you will create bold directions, think differently than other companies and also serve customers innovatively. The next leadership principle, bias for action, is meaning that you will value speed. That means that you will act quickly, take calculated risks. Always remember that Amazon has become so successful and in my opinion probably the best organisation in the world because it is prepared to take calculated risks. Not stupid risks but calculated risk and you always act decisively. The next leadership principle, through gality, this means that you will achieve more with fewer resources and you will also foster resourcefulness. Earned trust is the next leadership principle. So you will listen to others. Speak candidly, say how you feel professionally and also benchmark against the best organisations.
